snippet: A mural depicting scenes from Maine’s labor history returned to public display in Augusta on Monday, 22 months after Gov. Paul R. LePage set off a political firestorm by ordering it removed.
abstract: Mural depicting scenes from Maine’s labor history returns to public display in Augusta, 22 months after Gov Paul R LePage set off political firestorm by ordering it removed from the Labor Department, saying it offered a one-sided view of organized labor.
lead_paragraph: A mural depicting scenes from Maine’s labor history returned to public display in Augusta on Monday, 22 months after Gov. Paul R. LePage set off a political firestorm by ordering it removed.

headline.main: Maine: Disputed Mural Gets New Gallery
headline.print_headline: Maine: Disputed Mural Gets New Gallery
